main event: On November 30, 1954, a metallic object crashed through the roof of a house in Sylacauga, Alabama, injuring a woman.
interesting points: Hundreds of witnesses observed the object and its explosion across Alabama, Mississippi, and Georgia., The object was later identified as a meteorite weighing approximately 8.5 pounds., The injured woman was the first known person to be struck by a meteorite., The object created a three-foot-wide hole in the roof and skipped across the ground before coming to rest., The incident led to a significant military investigation and recovery efforts by the Air Force.
witness description: local residents and military personnel involved in the recovery and investigation
